result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Travis J. Turner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Travis J. Turner
Current: 6671 W Charles CT, Franklin, WI 53132 United States  (Effective: 12-29-2016)
Prior: 1009 Minnesota Ave #A, Stevens Point, WI 54481-3252 United States

ADDRESS INFO for Travis J. Turner
Current: 1009 Minnesota Ave #A, Stevens Point, WI 54481-3252 United States  (Effective: 07-27-2016)
Prior: 1540 Torun Road # 192A, Stevens Point, WI 54482 United States

Defendant Travis J. Turner in court with attorney Anne Renc. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 15CM13, 15CM139, 15CM140, 14CM523, 14CM560, 14TR4230, 14TR4231, 14TR4232, 15TR160

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

14TR4230 is being amended to between 11 to 15 over on a highway - 
Court informs defendant of charges. 
NO CONTEST plea. 
BY THE COURT:  Court finds the defendant guilty.  Pay forfeiture of $200.50.  To be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan.  14TR4231 & 14TR4232 are dismissed. 

15TR160 -
Court informs defendant of charges. 
NO CONTEST plea. 
Atty Cousins states facts.  BAC .116
BY THE COURT:  Court finds the defendant guilty.  Pay a forfeiture of $761.50.  $26.45 blood draw fee.  To be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan. 6 months revocation.  AODA and comply with the safety plan.  

Atty Cousins makes statement of uncharge read-in with DA case number 15PT1012.  Files Statement of Uncharged Read-in. 
 
Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CM523 Counts 1 & 2 - NO CONTEST
14CM560 Counts 1 & 2 - NO CONTEST
15CM13 Count 1 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 14CM523 Counts 1 & 2, 14CM560 Counts 1 & 2, 15CM13 Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

15CM139 & 15CM140 are dismissed and read-in.  15PT1012 is an uncharged read-in. 

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
14CM523 Count 1 -
Imposed and Stayed - 60 days jail
Huber if approved by the jail administration. 
Half to be served in jail and balance on Electronic monitoring if approved by RISK assessment and jail administration. 
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months:
Comply with treatment recommedations from his recent assessment.
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
All prescriptions from 1 pharmacy.
Sign necessary releases so agent can monitor prescription usage.
Engage in any counseling deemed appropriate by the agent. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 

14CM523 Count 2 - 
Imposed and Stayed - 60 days jail, concurrent with Count 1.
Huber if approved by the jail administration. 
Half to be served in jail and balance on Electronic monitoring if approved by RISK assessment and jail administration. 
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months, concurrent:
Comply with all conditions set forth in Count 1. 
Pay costs.  (No DNA surcharge ordered).

14CM560 Count 1 - 
Imposed and Stayed - 60 days jail, consecutive to 14CM523.
Huber if approved by the jail administration. 
First 30 days to be served in jail and balance on Electronic monitoring if approved by RISK assessment and jail administration.
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months:
Comply with conditions set forth in 14CM523 Count 1. 
Pay restitution of $180.00

14CM560 Count 2 - 
Imposed and Stayed - 60 days jail, concurrent with Count 1 but consecutive to 14CM523.
Huber if approved by the jail administration. 
First 30 days to be served in jail and balance on Electronic monitoring if approved by RISK assessment and jail administration.
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months:
Comply with conditions set forth in 14CM523 Count 1. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 

15CM13 Count 1 - 
Imposed and Stayed - 60 days jail, consecutive to all other sentences.
Huber if approved by the jail administration. 
First 30 days to be served in jail and balance on Electronic monitoring if approved by RISK assessment and jail administration.
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months, concurrent: 
Comply with all conditions set forth in 14CM523. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 

Parties address jail credit. 
Atty Renc indicates there is 4 days on a dismissed and read-in charge.

ADDRESS INFO for Travis J. Turner
Current: 1540 Torun Road # 192A, Stevens Point, WI 54482 United States  (Effective: 07-17-2015)
Prior: 2601 Forest Dr #29, Plover, WI 54467

Defendant Travis J. Turner in court with attorney Anne Renc. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 15CM139, 15CM140

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY plea entered.

Bond has been set in 15CM139 previously. 
State recommends a $2,000 signature bond with conditions as stated for 15CM140.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 09:45 am.

Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
  Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.

ADA Cass Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cass Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of Possession of Drugs, Fleeing.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $2,500 bond  with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:    @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch
